results.title: The Hare and the Tortoise
results.brief_description: An all-star cast of real animals and birds feature in this charming tale for children, based on Aesop’s fable. The wise old owl acts as judge, the fox lays out the woodland course for the race, the raccoon (who wakes up the sleeping hare, too late, of course), the gossipy goose, the rooster, and the hare and the tortoise, whose contest proves that the race is not always to the swift, all appear.

results.title: Hardware wars
results.brief_description: A hilarious parody of the space epic “Star Wars” [306301 / 300668 (captioned)]in which special effects are made with household appliances,available in any hardware store. The film takes on high budget spectaculars and “Coming Attraction” trailers, with particular emphasis on the special effects syndrome.

results.title: Hard work
results.brief_description: A film about Margo St. James and her fight to have prostitution decriminalized. Revolving around the Hooker’s Convention in Washington, D.C., the action takes place over a five-day period. It includes a visit to the Women’s Detention Center, TV and press interviews, a congressional cocktail party, the Hooker’s Ball and a sunrise walk around the White House. It is not a didactic study on the problem of prostitution but a thought and discussion-provoking vehicle that probes the moral and social values involved.

results.title: Hard water
results.creator_credit: Peter Griffiths, Michael Clarke, Unilever Films and View Point
results.brief_description: Rain falling to earth as a weak acid reaches the tap as a solution of ionic compounds. Soap reacts with these compounds to form insoluble calcium soap, precipitated as scum, while soapless detergents form soluble acid salts. Gives an explanation of water softening by ion exchange.

results.title: Hard to windward
results.creator_credit: Max Graham, Norman Laird and Tasmanian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Sydney-Hobart Yacht Race, Starting every year on Boxing Day. Shows the start in Sydney Harbour, following one boat through the race to the finish on the River Derwent, and celebrations and prize giving which follow.

results.title: A Hard course
results.creator_credit: Arthur Smith, Stanley Williamson and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: The arguments for and against the system of intensive training for boys and girls at the Outward Bound Mountain School in Cumberland. The school aims at “character training through adventure and testing experience”.

results.title: Hard brought up: child welfare story
results.brief_description: Shows public services available in one US community for answering social problems. When two boys rob a service station, they are brought before the juvenile court. A social worker investigates their family circumstances.

results.title: A Harbour goes to France
results.brief_description: The official British Army and Admiralty film of “Operation Mulberry”, the unique prefabricated harbour which was floated across the English Channel in sections, and erected in a matter of hours on the coast of Normandy during the critical days following D-Day, World War II.

results.title: Harambee, the world of the award
results.creator_credit: Stephen Cross, Robert Angell and Lion Pacesetter Films
results.brief_description: The Duke of Edinburgh’s Award Scheme is Commonwealth wide and it operates in forty countries. This film epitomises the spirit of the Award Scheme as shown in Kenya in 1971 when Gold Award winners from sixteen different countries gathered to learn, work and explore together.

results.title: Happy youth in sun and snow: winter holidays in Switzerland
results.brief_description: This film describes the facilities for children to learn winter sports under expert guidance. Skating, ice hockey, toboganning are shown, and training in skiing from the nursery slopes to racing is seen in some detail. No commentary, music soundtrack only.
